metadata.metaValue: The face centers array is in the same order as the face_ids.  We can use that to display the face ids.
The point position array is in the same order as the face_ids.  We can use that to display the point ids.
We make a new points object for display and get the array indices.

The numeric display needs a property to display.  We set our array indicies as that property

`set_point_shape` sets the shape for displaying and rendering point objects, and is why we constructed a new point object.

Because we only want to show one of these ids when the appropriate box is checked on the UI, we set up two if statements that will output an empty object when unselected.  Also, as this is for screen display only, there is no need for an output or connection to the "Final", renderable terminal connection
To lift the numeric display up out of the mesh, we take the relevant normals, multiply them by a small offset and add them to the position of the numeric points.
